FROM THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES
Spec & gen Orders & Circ & Circ letters
Division of Cuba Vol 175 A 1900

HEADQUARTERS DIVISION OF CUBA,
Havana, February 19, 1900.
Mr. Alexis E. Frye, Superintendent of Schools in Cuba;

Major Chauncey B. Baker, Quartermaster, U. S. Vol-
unteers;

1st Lieutenant Edward C. Brooks, 6th U. S. Cavalry,
Aide de Camp;

will convene in the office of the Chief Quartermaster of the
Division, at 10 o'clock A. M. to-day, to examine the bids
tendered for supply of school furniture for the Island of
Cuba, and recommend award.

2. Under authority of paragraph 1, General Orders No.
31, series of 1899, Headquarters of the Army, the Subsist-
ence Department will commute the rations of Private George
H. Turner, Hospital Corps, U.S. Army, now on duty with
the disinfecting detachment in the Department of Havana,
from and including February 20, 1900, and while engaged
in the performance of such duty, at the rate of one dollar
and fifty cents ($1.50) per day, it being impracticable to
provide for his subsistence in any other way.

3. The following named enlisted men of the Hospital
Corps, U. S. Army, are hereby relieved from duty at Mil-
itary Hospital No. 1, Havana, Cuba, and will proceed to
Quemados, Cuba, reporting upon arrival to the Chief Sur-
geon, Department of the Province of Havana and Pinar
del Río, for assignment to duty.

The Quartermaster's Department will furnish the neces-
sary transportation.
The travel enjoined is necessary for the public service.

4. Private Thomas Allison, troop D, 2d U. S. Cavalry, hav-
ing been tried by a general court martial convened at Santa
Cristina Barracks, Matanzas, Cuba, and found guilty of
fraudulent enlistment in violation of the 62d Article of
War, evidence of one previous conviction having been con-
sidered, was sentenced “To be dishonorably discharged the
